sn7.19:3.1: 19 The Brahmin Who Provided for His Mother
sn7.19:4.2: Then a brahmin who provided for his mother went up to the Buddha,
sn7.19:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn7.19:4.6: “Master Gotama, I seek for alms by legitimate means, which I use to provide for my mother and father.
sn7.19:4.7: In doing so, am I doing my duty?”
sn7.19:4.8: “Indeed, brahmin, in so doing you are doing your duty.
sn7.19:4.9: Whoever seeks for alms by legitimate means, and uses them to provide for their mother and father makes much merit.”
sn7.19:5.5: they’re praised in this life by the astute,
sn7.19:5.6: and they depart to rejoice in heaven.”
sn7.19:6.1: When he said this, the brahmin who provided for his mother said to the Buddha:
sn7.19:6.3: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
